title: Redesign website to match Australian Government visa check interface

requirements.summary: Redesign the AustralianVisaCheckPage to match the Australian Government Department of Home Affairs website style with dark blue header, coat of arms logo, navigation menu, and search icon
acceptanceCriteria: Page header uses dark navy blue (#002554 or similar) matching the government website
Australian Government coat of arms logo is displayed in the header
Header includes 'Department of Home Affairs' text
Header includes hamburger menu icon and search icon on appropriate sides
Navigation breadcrumbs display below header (Home > Visas > When you have a visa)

file_operations.description: Replace the existing header structure with a government-styled header featuring dark navy blue background (#002554), Australian Government coat of arms logo at frontend/public/assets/generated/aus-govt-logo.dim_200x80.png, 'Australian Government' and 'Department of Home Affairs' text, hamburger menu icon (left), and search icon (right). Add breadcrumb navigation below the header displaying 'Home > Visas > When you have a visa'. Verify the generated logo component's usage instructions before implementing.

Restructure the page to remove the existing AppLayout wrapper and implement the government website layout directly in this component, including the new header, navigation links section, and main content area to match the reference design.

requirements.summary: Update the main content area to use bright blue background with the heading 'Check visa details and conditions' in large white text
acceptanceCriteria: Main content area uses bright blue background matching the reference image
Heading text 'Check visa details and conditions' is displayed in large white font
Content section includes expandable/collapsible 'Check conditions online (VEVO)' section with dropdown arrow

file_operations.description: Replace the existing main content section background with bright blue (#006CB5). Change the main heading to 'Check visa details and conditions' styled in large white text. Add an expandable/collapsible section labeled 'Check conditions online (VEVO)' with a dropdown arrow icon that toggles visibility of the visa check form content.

requirements.summary: Maintain the existing functionality to check visa application status using reference number and email with prominent, clearly labeled input fields
acceptanceCriteria: Reference number input field is clearly visible and labeled
Email input field is clearly visible and labeled
Existing normalization logic for applicationId and email is preserved
useCheckApplicationStatus mutation hook continues to function correctly

file_operations.description: Preserve the existing form inputs (applicationId and email) and the check button, ensuring they remain prominently displayed and clearly labeled. Keep all existing normalization logic from applicationStatusNormalization.ts and the useCheckApplicationStatus mutation hook integration intact. Style the form controls to fit within the new government design theme while maintaining full functionality.

requirements.summary: Add navigation links in the header area matching the government website style for ImmiAccount, VEVO, and My Tourist Refund Scheme
acceptanceCriteria: Three navigation links are displayed below the main header
Links are styled with white text on the dark blue background
Links maintain consistent spacing and alignment

file_operations.description: Add a navigation section immediately below the main header containing three links: 'ImmiAccount', 'Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)', and 'My Tourist Refund Scheme (TRS)'. Style these links with white text on dark blue background matching the header, with consistent horizontal spacing and alignment. These links are non-functional placeholders matching the visual design of the reference website.
